issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I'm seeing instances which fail to get a public IP when they go to 'running' state. Looks like the CLC has a hiccup and ends up revoking an already assigned ip from the instance just as it goes to running state. Few things to note:
-This is a large m3.2xlarge instance running in KVM. 
-This is following a power outage on this system. 
-This is following a failed attempt to boot a large 18g BFEBS instance which timed out on the volume create. 
-Assigning the instance an allocated ip is a way to restore a public IP to these instances. 

Below are snippets from CC and CLC for two cases where an instance's pub IP was revoked.
Thanks,
-M


{code}
--------------------------------------------------------
On CC:
--------------------------------------------------------

2013-10-23 15:10:15 DEBUG 000018999 doUnassignAddress        | found instance i-FA91454E in cache with IP 10.111.101.100
2013-10-23 15:10:15 DEBUG 000018999 pubIpSet                 | pubIpSet(): set: 10.111.101.100/0.0.0.0


--------------------------------------------------------
On the CLC:
--------------------------------------------------------

fields.summary: Instance public IPs revoked before running.

comments.body: I have not been able to reproduce this issue.

[~sjones] thanks for looking into this. I was able to reproduce this again following another timeout on a large bfebs image. I'm testing now to see if this can be reproduced by simply reducing the 'cloud.vmstate.ebs_volume_creation_timeout' property to something shorter than 30 minutes. My first attempts setting this to 1 and 5 minutes did not reproduce the issue. 
Thanks!
-M

Below is the first instance attempt following the timed out bfebs run attempt (i-C6CC3F4A)...

{code}
#Timed out instance...
[root@a-38 ~]# euca-describe-instances
RESERVATION	r-1C443F83	819096079876	test
INSTANCE	i-C6CC3F4A	emi-9A1639C2	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0	terminated	test	0		m3.2xlarge	2013-10-25T04:16:55.307Z	PARTI00		monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			ebs					hvm						
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sda	vol-A6E93FF3	2013-10-25T04:16:55.624Z	true		


[root@a-38 ~]# euca-modify-property -peuca='com.eucalyptus.address.AbstractSystemAddressManager.orphans'
PROPERTY	euca	{ClusterAddressInfo 10.111.101.100 0.0.0.0=361, ClusterAddressInfo 10.111.101.133 1.115.167.188=2} was executed successfully.

#First instance ran after timed out instance....
[root@a-38 ~]# [root@a-38 ~]# euca-run-instances -k test -g test -t m3.2xlarge -zPARTI00 emi-43C939AE
RESERVATION	r-E43E4365	819096079876	test
INSTANCE	i-1AB441B3	emi-43C939AE	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0	pending	test	0		m3.2xlarge	2013-10-25T05:06:52.212Z	PARTI00	eki-1F4B3B18	eri-E3A03782		monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			instance-store					paravirtualized	

#Instance does not get a public IP...
[root@a-38 ~]# euca-describe-instances
RESERVATION	r-E43E4365	819096079876	test
INSTANCE	i-1AB441B3	emi-43C939AE	1.115.165.93	1.115.165.93	running	test	0		m3.2xlarge	2013-10-25T05:06:52.212Z	PARTI00	eki-1F4B3B18	eri-E3A03782		monitoring-disabled	1.115.165.93	1.115.165.93			instance-store					paravirtualized						
TAG	instance	i-1AB441B3	euca:node	10.111.5.144
RESERVATION	r-1C443F83	819096079876	test
INSTANCE	i-C6CC3F4A	emi-9A1639C2	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0	terminated	test	0		m3.2xlarge	2013-10-25T04:16:55.307Z	PARTI00		monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			ebs					hvm						
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sda	vol-A6E93FF3	2013-10-25T04:16:55.624Z	true		

[root@a-38 ~]# euca-modify-property -peuca='com.eucalyptus.address.AbstractSystemAddressManager.orphans'
PROPERTY	euca	{ClusterAddressInfo 10.111.101.133 1.115.167.188=2} was executed successfully.
{code}


From CLC cloud-output...

{code}
2013-10-24 22:06:53 ERROR 000102428 ReplyQueue               | Failed to identify request context for received error: ExceptionMessage{payload={NullPayload}, context={MULE_CORRELATION_SEQUENCE=-1, MULE_CORRELATION_GROUP_SIZE=-1, MULE_ENCODING=UTF-8, MULE_CORRELATION_ID=4334d867-3d33-11e3-93f3-73dc568529a8}exception=org.mule.component.ComponentException: Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{WalrusReplyQueue.component}. Message payload is of type: NullPayload, componentName='WalrusReplyQueue', endpointUri=vm://WalrusReplyQueue, timeStamp=Thu Oct 24 22:06:53 PDT 2013}
2013-10-24 22:06:53 ERROR 000102428 Contexts                 | com.eucalyptus.context.IllegalContextAccessException: Cannot access context implicitly using lookup(V) when not handling a request.
2013-10-24 22:06:53  INFO 000100950 Address                  | :1382677613458:Address:ADDRESS_STATE:BOTTOM:Address 10.111.101.100 arn:aws:euare:000000000000:user/eucalyptus i-1AB441B3 1.115.165.93  AddressTransition assigning:impending->assigned(true)
...
...
2013-10-24 22:06:56 DEBUG 000102424 Address                  | Address not found for removal '10.111.101.100'
...
...
2013-10-24 22:06:59  INFO 000100950 VmRuntimeState           | i-1AB441B3 state change: PENDING -> RUNNING (previously PENDING)

{code}

I have reproduced this by using the following settings to reduce the time take for the issue to occur:

{code}
euca-modify-property -pcloud.addresses.maxkillorphans=14
euca-modify-property -pcloud.vmstate.ebs_volume_creation_timeout=2
{code}

this allows an "ebs" instance run with the instance type "m2.2xlarge" (I used a 20GiB root) to time out after a couple of minutes causing a subsequently launched instance some chance of loosing it's public address:

{code}
# euca-run-instances emi-64DE3A85
RESERVATION	r-4A043E57	515601106369	default
INSTANCE	i-C6E74346	emi-64DE3A85	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0	pending		0		m1.small	2013-11-04T23:15:00.272Z	PARTI00	eki-695A3D92	eri-862039BF		monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			instance-store					paravirtualized					
# euca-describe-instances
RESERVATION	r-4A043E57	515601106369	default
INSTANCE	i-C6E74346	emi-64DE3A85	10.111.103.243	172.26.102.185	pending		0		m1.small	2013-11-04T23:15:00.272Z	PARTI00	eki-695A3D92	eri-862039BFmonitoring-disabled	10.111.103.243	172.26.102.185			instance-store					paravirtualized						
TAG	instance	i-C6E74346	euca:node	10.111.1.101
# euca-describe-instances
RESERVATION	r-4A043E57	515601106369	default
INSTANCE	i-C6E74346	emi-64DE3A85	172.26.102.185	172.26.102.185	running		0		m1.small	2013-11-04T23:15:00.272Z	PARTI00	eki-695A3D92	eri-862039BFmonitoring-disabled	172.26.102.185	172.26.102.185			instance-store					paravirtualized						
TAG	instance	i-C6E74346	euca:node	10.111.1.101
{code}
Need to merge this change for QA.

A slightly cleaned up version of the commit was merged for 3.4 testing:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/commit/8b70ce2ea46885c4f646d096ef0dfc1df0b6e836
Using the Steves reproduction steps I am not seeing the IP's being revoked.
